channel.title: CVE Feed for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiEDR
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Fortinet -- Fortinet FortiEDR

item.title: CVE-2022-23446|2024-08-03T03:43:45.885Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortiedr
item.description: A improper control of a resource through its lifetime in Fortinet FortiEDR version 5.0.3 and earlier allows attacker to make the whole application unresponsive via changing its root directory access permission.

item.title: CVE-2022-39949|2024-08-03T12:07:42.936Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortiedr
item.description: An improper control of a resource through its lifetime vulnerability [CWE-664] in FortiEDR CollectorWindows 4.0.0 through 4.1, 5.0.0 through 5.0.3.751, 5.1.0 may allow a privileged user to terminate the FortiEDR processes with special tools and bypass the EDR protection.

item.title: CVE-2022-23440|2024-08-03T03:43:45.919Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortiedr
item.description: A use of hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability [CWE-321] in the registration mechanism of FortiEDR collectors versions 5.0.2, 5.0.1, 5.0.0, 4.0.0 may allow a local attacker to disable and uninstall the collectors from the end-points within the same deployment.

item.title: CVE-2022-29057|2024-08-03T06:10:59.274Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortiedr
item.description: A improper neutralization of input during web page generation ('cross-site scripting') in Fortinet FortiEDR version 5.1.0, 5.0.0 through 5.0.3 Patch 6 and 4.0.0 allows a remote authenticated attacker to perform a reflected cross site scripting attack (XSS) by injecting malicious payload into the Management Console via various endpoints.

item.title: CVE-2022-23441|2024-08-03T03:43:45.940Z -- fortinet -- fortinet%20fortiedr
item.description: A use of hard-coded cryptographic key vulnerability [CWE-321] in FortiEDR versions 5.0.2, 5.0.1, 5.0.0, 4.0.0 may allow an unauthenticated attacker on the network to disguise as and forge messages from other collectors.
